alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:24PM EST until January 11 at 11:17PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut... Quinebaug River near Jewett City affecting New London County. For the Quinebaug...including Jewett City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Quinebaug River near Jewett City. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Norman Road and banjo Sullivan Road are closed with water covering the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.5 ft. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Wednesday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage again late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 10/16/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Quinebaug River Jewett City 17.5 17.8 Wed 5 pm EST 16.3 12.9 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 630 AM EST.
